titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the James E. Dittes Papers
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Martha Lund Smalley

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday March 26, 2019 at 22:10

did.unittitle: James E. Dittes Papers
did.abstract: This collection documents the academic career of Yale professor James E. Dittes. Dittes received his B.D. and Ph.D. from Yale and taught Pastoral Theology and the Psychology of Religion at Yale beginning in 1955.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: James E. Dittes Papers (RG 174), Special Collections, Yale Divinity School Library.

chronitem.event: M.S., Yale University, Department of Psychology
Ph.D., Yale University, Department of Psychology
Instructor to Associate Professor, Psychology of Religion, Yale University
Executive Secretary, Society for the Scientific Study of Religion
Editor, Journal for the Scientific Study of Religion
Professor, Psychology of Religion, Yale University
Director of Graduate Studies, Department of Religious Studies, Yale University
Chairperson, Department of Religious Studies, Yale University
Professor, Pastoral Theology and Psychology, Yale University

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These papers were given to the library by Prof. Dittes as he approached retirement. They document his long and noteworthy academic career at Yale. Series I, Correspondence, provides a glimpse of issues and activities that have been important to Dittes over the past half century. Series II, Writings, includes sermons, talks, lectures, published articles, papers written while Dittes was a student, unpublished papers, and reviews. Series III, Course-Related Materials, provides a good overview of courses taught by Dittes from 1955 to 1999. Series IV, Personal and Biographical Material, includes autobiographical writings and other material documenting Dittes' life and work.
